page.title: 04TREES.
page.content:
A very large number of{orchard}trees were{felled}for the new houses. Also a large no. of good deciduous trees have been felled, many on Bircher Hall land.{Bircher Knoll},once a mature deciduous copse was destroyed and re- seeded in 1975. A tree planting scheme was started in 1977 by the Misses Wenham and Elliott,A.W.+A.S.Thompson,G.W.Thomas, Miss G.Dunne,Carol Morris,John Morris, K.Cradduck,J.Sansum,chaired by Tom E. Howard. Since then about 100 trees have survived incl.{Thomas' Copse}near Highwood, and{Richard's Copse}by the Chapel on the Common.{Croft Estate} have planted 180 limes, 21 beeches,48 oaks,16 copper beeches,12 sorbus,150 ash + 17 various trees,some are planted in avenues.
.
